title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: No interview required. Pretty straight foward. All you have to do is make sure you meet the requirements as a full time student a k-state and apply online through handshake or directly on their website.d
Interview Questions: I was asked when I wanted to start, and number of hours I would be working a week

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview about a week after applying. There was a panel interview via zoom and a second in person interview with the same panel. I was able to schedule online and choose from 3 or 4 times for both interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience with managing competing priorities. Tell us about how you handle difficult situations. Tell us about a time you used organization skills to accomplish a task.

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: The process was very organized and professional. I didn’t get an offer, but they treated me with respect the entire way through. They wanted to hire for an onsite position, but left the conversation open.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an experience identifying new prospects.

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Quick and friendly interview with specific questions that were not open ended. Had a lot of fun talking to the interviewer. I would not stress about getting hired here if you are an outgoing/helpful person.
Interview Questions: What do you think is your greatest weakness?

title: Market Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: zoom screen assigment, then presentation final interview with director *They spoke with my reference via zoom, despiting having two internal canidates already lined up. They wasted my time and my references. *
Interview Questions: What software are you familiar with?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews with hiring manager and in person interview. The in person interview includes more people from the department you will be working in. I received a phone call with an offer approximately 1 week after the interview.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with students?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Basic Problem-solving questions. How many hours I am available to work? What makes me a good candidate for the job? The process includes a written application and then an interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a situation arose that you didn't know how to handle

title: Assistant Building Supervisor/Weight Room Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kansas State University in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with about 6 other people initially then was offered a 1 on 1 interview. Went very quick boss was very friendly. Was notified I received the job shortly after
Interview Questions: What my favorite college memory had been thus far

title: Vet School Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very conversational! It wasn't extremely stressful and all of the interviewers were extremely friendly.  The questions were not surprising and pretty broad. Offers have not been sent out yet.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: There was a screening phone call with basic questions. The second interview was a half day interview with different office and community partners. The questions were basic experience, fit for the role and a few scenarios
Interview Questions: What are you interested in the role?

title: Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview for Flight Dispatch was very good.  It only took about 15 minutes and he was able to answer every question I had. I loved working with the team.
Interview Questions: How good are you with computers?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: I inquired one of my professors about the opportunity and she invited me to her office to talk about it one day. We discussed the position and she asked me a few questions about what I wanted from the position. At the end of the meeting she offered me the position.
Interview Questions: What I seek to gain from the opportunity.

title: Facilities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: There were four interviewers. They asked me 10 questions one by one. It lasted for about one hour. It was very intensive for me at that time. But I think that it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Supervisory experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I had a very good interview in a very friendly environment, they had very professional behavior.
Clear expectation.
I also saw very respectful behavior from HR and they are very helpful for you to start there. Also, the professors are very nice and freindly.
Interview Questions: Explain your background and experience in the field.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a faculty member who already knew my background and was qualified for the summer position, being an incoming senior. Once I turned in my application(provided by faculty member) I received an email for an interview. This was with a faculty member I was already familiar with, so it went casually. We went through a series of situational interview questions in his office, and once all the students who applied were interviewed, we received an email on who had the summer position.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a student that is doing something you are aware they are not supposed to be doing?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Basically just asked my availability for student worker at the dining center, nothing else. It was super easy and I didn’t have any problems. The dining centers are always looking for people, so if you are a student, they will pretty much always hire you.
Interview Questions: When are you available to work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was standard behavioral questions. Went through several rounds to meet with everyone in the office. The interview also includes lunch with a staff member. The university paid for the hotel and flight.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle multitasking?
Are you used to the mid-west small town vibe?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: A screening call was followed by an online panel interview with the hiring team. I was then given some test data and was asked to work the data and present it professionally in my face-to-face interview (again a panel).
Interview Questions: How do you ensure that your results are accurate?

title: Office Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went through a 30 minute Zoom interview with a search committee, then I went through 3 hours of interviews with the search committee, the entire unit and then the person who would be my supervisor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be at K-State?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS)
Interview Descriptions: Sent an email to the professor and he responded the next day.  Set up a interview with in the next couple of days. I head back the day of the interview stating I got the job.
Interview Questions: All the questions were pretty much standard. For example what are your strength/ weaknesses or why would you be suitable for the job

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied through university website, filtered, and interviewed personally. Oral questions and work presentation. Job selection hiring . Presentation, panel discussion question and answering, siting for the decision for 1 month and finally got the job
Interview Questions: When did you graduated?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was slow. It took several weeks to hear back after applying, and the two interviews were spaced apart over two weeks. The interview was average in duration and difficulty. Staff was easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: What specifically attracted you to apply at KSU?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kansas State University in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions about who you are and what your experiences are with IT and how you are able to communicate with people? Also, what is something you would change about the job?
Interview Questions: What is something you are proud of?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The professor asked me about my experience and my current project. We talk about my situation, my future payment, and my work time. I graduate from KSU and continue to working here. So I did not have too much advice on this process
Interview Questions: about my previous experience projects

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: it was average difficult. however, they understand students very well. they go through your academic progress and current schedule. they try to make it more flexible work hours according to your need.
Interview Questions: what is your weakness?

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online on K-State's career website and received an email from HR.
HR scheduled a video interview with the entire team, Director of the department and HR for about 1 hour. They mainly focus on if you are a good fit in their team and your ability to learn new technologies. After a week received a call from the Project Manager and discussed the numbers and start date.
Interview Questions: Few technical questions on DLL files.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: I scheduled a phone interview and after I completed the interview I was invited to an on-campus interview. Because I was living in another state we arranged a Skype interview.  I was told I would hear back in one week however it took longer for them to make an offer.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you gave customer service that was above and beyond.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: The Admissions Representative interview lasted several hours. During that time, I was interviewed by multiple panels, the Associate Vice President for Student Life and Director, as well as the Vice President for Student Life. The interview questions were mainly behavioral and situational based. I was also asked to prepare a presentation beforehand, which I then presented to a group of about 20 people who work in some capacity with New Student Services, as well as the other candidates. Each candidate took turns giving our presentations.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were in a difficult situation and had to build rapport quickly with those around you.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions:
It was a personal interview. Basically knowing more about myself and do I fit for the role of Graduate Research Assistant. Does interest align with the current research project.
It was a personal interview. Basically knowing more about myself and do I fit for the role of Graduate Research Assistant. Does interest align with the current research project.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Information Technology Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
3 hour long interview including - Skype Interview (3 questions), In person interview, 20min Presentation, and Tour of school.

-They invited 6 candidates to interview on campus, I personally think that is too many (4 or 5 would have been better... give your candidates at least a 20% hope of employment)
-Were willing to pay for my expenses (after filling a W9)
-Did not provide information on the location where I would be received, so I started off a little lost.
-Empty feeling after interview... Like they shook my hand and kicked me back out into the cold cruel world
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Mostly two round interviews, first round online interview, and then on-campus interview if pass the first round successfully.  Interview questions vary in each department. Mostly few interviewers to one interviewee.
Interview Questions: What do you do when you are overwhelmed?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty easy and straight to the point. I was interviewed by a panel. They were all nice and I wasn't intimidated. It lasted for about 90 minutes in total.
Interview Questions: Mostly about your previous job experiences, your ability to work around students. It was easy questions if you're applying for a position that suits your skills and knowledge.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University (New York, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: They were efficient, professional, and very courteous and respectful of my time.  I was interviewed by the director of HR and the director that I would be reporting to its hired.  It seemed like a very welcoming environment. I liked the neighborhood. The location of the organization is very accessible five public transportation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for AFA?

title: Mathematics Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, mostly get to know you questions and asking about what experiences you have had. If you act normally and seem enthusiastic about working their it should all go well.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses?

title: Software Engineer Library Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: They went over my resume and asked me about different programming languages and about different experiences I had in the past. They also asked me questions about the Fibonacci sequence and asked if I could demonstrate it for them.
Interview Questions: Can you show us the Fibonacci sequence using any language you prefer?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was basically non-existence all that was required was a certain grade in the course you are grading for and an email/talk with the department. If they decide to move forward with you you will get an email back and from there it is just basic job paperwork with meetups to prepare before the classes start
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Manager, Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a day long process. First meet with the HR team, then the selection committee, then the VP, then a tour, then with the specific department that I would be working with
Interview Questions: The recurring question was how well did I handle academic bullies.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I wanted to work on something along with my studies. I simply talked to my professor and gave him reasons why I want to work on a project with him.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for? What are your areas of interest that you would like a project on?

title: Hazardous Waste Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview that I had was a very brief and informal interview with the environmental manager, Kelly. It wasn't necessary to dress in a suit. I just met with her and another employee and they just had to make sure I was an enrolled student, passed background check, etc.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with DOT chemical classifications?

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Make friends with a professor, see if they have any relevant research opportunities coming up that you would be a good fit for.  Will examine your GPA (transcript) and GRE scores.
Interview Questions: How would you go about solving (X Problem) ?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very fast turn around. I turned in my application and the next day I had a call and then the next week, I went in for an interview and was hired on the spot
Interview Questions: It was all behavioral

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Not too many technical questions. I worked for the KSU Graduate School where the job responsibilities where over many areas from hardware to software. Troubleshooting kind of daily jobs where given very often. Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Questions on just resume.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: 2 in depth interviews going over job offered and my previous work history.  Met with 3 high ranking people in the division for the preliminary interview.  The next day got a phone call requesting a second interview that was one on one with the senior Vice President in one weeks time.  That interview also went well and later that afternoon I got a phone call offering me the position.
Interview Questions: There will be times when 40 hours a week does not cover the work load that you need to handle.  Is it a problem for you to work extra to complete your job expectations?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The position was advertized online. I wrote an application package and submitted it via email. I was then emailed to ask if I would be available for a Skype interview. This was conducted a couple of days later. It was a panel interview consisting of the 3 people on the search committee.
Interview Questions: How would you feel about living in Manhattan, KS  - hard as I had not visited the town before.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Initial email communication and subsequent interview. Faculty seemed kind and friendly.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a phone call for an initial screening interview. Then was flown to Manhattan, Kansas ( all expenses paid). I was taken to dinner and breakfast and then had to present my research work as a seminar. I attended the lab meeting and was how around the lab and the school. I also met with several lab members who gave me helpful information about the work and the environment.
Interview Questions: What do you like/attracted you to your field?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Very low key interview process. I submitted an application and got a call the next day. The interview consisted of 4 different managers (2 ARLC's of the dorm and 2 desk managers). The interview lasted a total of 20 minutes, and I felt like they did a good job of getting to know the candidates during the process
Interview Questions: No difficult questions

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kansas State University in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Questions were very common, not a single one surprising.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: 2 hour interview that was very detailed in front of whole staff, did not include HR or representative of the college just the department. I should have seen that as a red flag.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working with professors who have a high opinion of themselves.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kansas State University
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared.  Do your homework and ask questions.
Interview Questions: Why U of K?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I saw the opening on the page of the professor and send him my resume. Then I got a call one week later and make a schedule for interview. The interview is one by one, last about one hour. One week later, I got the offer.
Interview Questions: just some questions about my previous experiences, something about java and c++

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I searched online and applied online for Phd program of chemical engineering in KSU. And got the offer the next day. And I really suspect the reality of the offer. Finally turns out it was real. But it took a long time to get I20. I have visa and flight ticket and came to USA finally.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel of about 4 interviewers asked me about different experiences in my past. There was a prepared set of questions that were asked in a linear pattern. Most questions were open ended situation based questions. I had to answer them by providing examples from my past experiences and emphasizing problem solving, strong team work, negotiation and analytic skills.
Interview Questions: Give an example of conflict with your supervisor and how did you handle it?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Department and grad school take the decision regarding  with GRE and undergrad GPA score. previous research experience will be help little. International student should submit good TOEFL score. Some time graduate admission committee call for a short interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a Doctor of Philosophy program in Electrical and computer engineering department at Kansas state university about three years ago. After the application, you will receive a confirmation email from Kansas State University. If there is a professor who interests in your application, he will contact you and set up an interview. If everything works well, you willget the offer.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, the supervisor essentially explained the job to me and asked if I wanted and was willing to do it.  Most of the "interview" questions where normal in-the-box questions (tell me a little about yourself, what made you want to apply for this job, what type of skills do you have that would make you an outstanding candidate for this position, how long do you plan to be with the department)
Interview Questions: Where is your inevitable goal for a career that you love?

title: Teaching Assistant CIS 115 Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was just asked basic questions about my interest in programming 
and some questions about python
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job ?

title: IT Help Desk Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied in person, was called about a week later and had an interview with three hiring managers.  I was asked questions regarding my previous employment, technical knowledge and customer service experience. I was also asked about availability and given the job description in detail. After that the hiring managers asked me was I still interested in continuing with the application/interview process.
Interview Questions:
What are some of your strengths/weaknesses
Scenario questions (ex: If you were faced with an angry customer how would you handle the situation?)

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
First, I make a contact by email after I saw the announcement of the position. They asked me my CV and 2 weeks later I received an email with an invitation to the on-site interview.
The interview is with the professor you are going to be working. Experience was nice. A whole day on-site interview.
You talked about some particular problems (in my case a physical problem) and then they will ask you how to solve the same or a different problem. You have to think about the problem and propose a solution. Later the professor will ask you about your background and other projects you have been working. In some  case, they can ask you to give a talk about your research project, but in my case, they did not. The professor invited me to go for a lunch and we spent some time talking again about science during the lunch time. Again, some question to be answered.
Later I was dropped with other fellows working in the same group where I introduced myself and they asked me questions about my works and I also asked them some questions. Later in the night, other fellows picked me up for a dinner. During the dinner, we did not talk about science only about personal things, like how is the life in the city, and other things. Overall it was a good experience, one week later they sent me an offer and I accepted.
Interview Questions: How did you solve this problem in your research paper ? (The question can be any related with a particular point in your paper they only wanted to be sure you did the work in the paper and not other people)

title: Associate Coordinator for New Student Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: They called me in for a half day interview and covered all travel and stay plans. I had an introductory and exit interview with the VP for NSE. In between, I had two group interviews. The questions were intensive and sometimes even vague but the people were very patient and hospitable. An example of a questions would be, "Describe an example when you had to separate the person from the issue at hand".
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you had to conince you supervisor about something.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Its was basically about the skills I have and what are the things I am motivated to do.
Which projects you like from the research
Professor will attach to a experienced grad and will take review from him after 2 weeks about the ideas/ questions I raised during the procedure.
Interview Questions: Which projects you like from the research

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Got an A in a graudate level course and the professor recommended me to become a GTA for next semester.
Interview Questions: Do you know the languages used in the course.

title: Instructor In Architecture Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had recently graduated from the program so it was relatively easy going and non-chalant although it took three tries to get the first paper contracts together. First the salary was lower than agreed join, then the dates were wrong, then the dates were wrong again, finally the fourth try was correct.
Interview Questions: My interview didn't consist much of this because it was originally to only be a temporary position to fill in for a professor friend while he was in sabbatical. It became much more.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: someone recommended me to a faculty, who needed some fresh PhD to work on a project from a company and collaborate with the scientists in that company. My skills, experiences and background knowledge match this position very well. The professor made an appointment to interview me after he received my resume and the recommendation letters. The first interview was 1-1 phone screening followed by a panel interview. The interviews went through very well and an offer was  made very soon. I accepted this offer.
Interview Questions: Did you postpone some deadline and why?

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Took a 10 hour course on what it is to be a personal trainer, went through the process of accepting and training clients, safety practices, certifications, followed by completing some exercises. At the end of the course all applicants took a written test, if scored high enough you moved on to an audition with an actual client while the person(s) in charge of hiring were present.
Interview Questions: How do you motivate yourself for exercise, what keeps you going.

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kansas State University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Standard open search as in general in academia
Interview Questions: How would you teach classes that you have never taught before
